alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 11:59AM CST until March 08 at 1:20PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Leroy affecting Clarke and Washington Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River Near Leroy. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 26.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CST Sunday was 27.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.6 feet on 02/02/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
